page.title: 06STAUNTON HAROLD RESERVOIR
page.content: Staunton Harold Reservoir is a linear expanse of water in the natural valley between Melbourne,Calke and Staunton Harold, fed by two small lakes with a main pumping station. The surrounding banking of the reservoir is mainly farmland, pasture for grazing and arable for wheat and barley crops. The S.W. side is covered with planted woodland, deciduous and conifers, known as Spring Wood and Melbourne Plantation. There are bird watching hides in these woods to view the varied bird life e.g. ducks geese gulls swans heron kingfisher coot moorhen and grebes. The water is used for a variety of leisure activities - fishing(by permit only) sailing and windsurfing. The N.E. side is a recreational walk running from Broadstone Lane to the Windmill car-park.
